content: Bernie believes in creating a strong, educated workforce by providing a free college education.
subcontent: How? By reforming the student loan system to stop taking advantage of students. Also, by taxing Wall Street and ensuring that colleges are accountable for providing quality education to students.

content: Bernie's message has been consistent for 4 decades.
subcontent: Bernie has always been sticking up for the working class and the interests of the common voter. Not for special interests.

content: Bernie currently has a strong grassroots campaign, rivaling President's Obama's campaign from 2007.
subcontent: By the end of Q3 2015, Bernie Sanders had 650,000 total contributors, 298,000 more than President Obama during Q3 2007.

content: Bernie won the 2016 New Hampshire Primary, and earned over 151,000 votes.
subcontent: That's the most votes ever won by a candidate in the New Hampshire Primary.

content: Bernie has and continues to push campaign finance reform.
subcontent: His goals include overturning Citizens United and fighting for public, transparent campaign financing.

content: Bernie would be the oldest president if elected, at age 75.
Bernie's known for actively doing his job in Congress.
subcontent: He spoke in an 8 hour filibuster against tax cuts for millionaires and billionaires in 2010.

content: Bernie does not take money from super PACs.
subcontent: Yet, his campaign raised more than $1.5 million during the first 24 hours, most of which being small donations.

content: Bernie plans to create a Medicare-for-all plan in order to provide comprehensive care to all Americans.
subcontent: While taxes would go up, families would end up saving money by not paying deductibles or copays.

content: Bernie believes in implementing a higher, livable minimum wage of $15 an hour.
subcontent: This wage, already rolling out in cities like Seattle, plans to improve the lives of struggling workers.

content: Bernie's net worth is much lower than the average 2016 presidential candidate.
subcontent: His net worth is estimated to be around $330k, close to Marco Rubio's estimated $443k.

content: Bernie has detailed plans on how to pay for his liberal proposals.
subcontent: His spending programs plan to have corporations and wealthy individuals pay their fair share of taxes.

content: Bernie plans on addressing family values by giving more benefits and rights to the working class.
subcontent: This includes family and medical leave, sick leave, and guaranteed vacation time.

content: As a Vermont senator, Bernie has priorities to improve life in rural communities.
subcontent: Supporting small farms, agriculture, and rural infrastructure are on Bernie's agenda.
Not a traditional socialist. Private small businesses and corporations will still exist under Bernie's agenda.

content: Bernie believes in clean energy through taxing carbon.
subcontent: By taxing carbon, there's an incentive to find cleaner energy solutions.

content: Bernie's top historical contributors have mostly been unions.
subcontent: These unions include sheet metal workers, postal workers, nurses, and aerospace workers.

content: Bernie believes in and has actively attempted to legalize marijuana.
Bernie believes in providing racial justice through addressing violence towards minorities.
subcontent: These types of violence include physical, political, legal, economic, and environmental.
